task.name: plotbandpass
task.shortdescription: Makes detailed plots of Tsys and bandpass solutions.
task.description: Developed at the NAASC, this is a generic task to display CASA Tsys and bandpass solution tables with options to overlay them in various combinations, and/or with an atmospheric transmission or sky temperature model. It works with both the 'new' (casa 3.4) and 'old' calibration table formats, and allows for mixed mode spws (e.g. TDM and FDM for ALMA). It uses the new msmd tool to access the information about an ms. This task is still being developed as new ALMA observing modes are commissioned. So if you encounter problems, please report them.

param.name: caltable
param.description: Input table name, either a bandpass solution or a Tsys solution

param.name: antenna
param.description: A comma-delimited string list of antennas (either names or integer indices) for which to display solutions. Default = all antennas.

param.name: field
param.description: A comma-delimited string list of fields (either names or integer indices) for which to display solutions. Default = all fields.

param.name: spw
param.description: A comma-delimited string list of spws for which to display solutions. Default = all spws.

param.name: yaxis
param.description: The quantity to plot on the y-axis ("amp", "phase", "both", "tsys", append "db" for dB).

param.name: xaxis
param.description: The quantity to plot on the x-axis ("chan" or "freq").

param.name: figfile
param.description: The name of the plot file to produce.

param.name: plotrange
param.description: The axes limits to use [x0,x1,y0,y1].

param.name: caltable2
param.description: A second cal table, of type BPOLY or B, to overlay on a B table

param.name: overlay
param.description: Show multiple solutions in same frame in different colors (time, antenna, spw, baseband, or time,antenna)

param.name: showflagged
param.description: Show the values of the solution, even if flagged

param.name: timeranges
param.description: Show only these timeranges, the first timerange being 0

param.name: buildpdf
param.description: If True, assemble all the pngs into a pdf

param.name: caltable3
param.description: A third cal table, of type BPOLY, to overlay on the first two tables

param.name: markersize
param.description: Size of points

param.name: density
param.description: dpi to use in creating PNGs and PDFs (default=108)

param.name: interactive
param.description: if False, then run to completion automatically without pause

param.name: showpoints
param.description: Draw points for the data (default=F for amp, T for phase)

param.name: showlines
param.description: Draw lines connecting the data (default=T for amp, F for phase)

param.name: subplot
param.description: 11..81,22,32 or 42 for RowsxColumns (default=22), any 3rd digit is ignored

param.name: zoom
param.description: "intersect" will zoom to overlap region of caltable with caltable2

param.name: poln
param.description: Polarizations to plot: "" = all, or "RR","RL","LR","LL","XX","XY","YX","YY","RR,LL","XX,YY"

param.name: showatm
param.description: Compute and overlay the atmospheric transmission curve

param.name: pwv
param.description: Define the pwv to use for the showatm option: "auto" or value in mm

param.name: gs
param.description: For buildpdf=T, full path for ghostscript command (in case it is not found)

param.name: convert
param.description: For buildpdf=T, full path for the ImageMagick convert command (in case it is not found)

param.name: chanrange
param.description: Set xrange ("5~100") over which to autoscale y-axis for xaxis="freq"

param.name: solutionTimeThresholdSeconds
param.description: Consider 2 solutions simultaneous if within this interval in seconds

param.name: debug
param.description: Print verbose messages for debugging purposes

param.name: phase
param.description: The y-axis limits to use for phase plots when yaxis="both"

param.name: vis
param.description: name of the ms for this table, in case it does not match the string in the caltable

param.name: showtsky
param.description: Compute and overlay the sky temperature curve instead of transmission

param.name: showfdm
param.description: when showing TDM spws, draw the locations of the corresponding FDM spws

param.name: showatmfield
param.description: for overlay="time", use first observation of this fieldID or name

param.name: lo1
param.description: specify the LO1 setting (in GHz) for the observation ('' = automatic)

param.name: showimage
param.description: also show the atmospheric curve for the image sideband (in black)

param.name: showatmpoints
param.description: Draw atmospheric curve with points instead of a line

param.name: parentms
param.description: if showimage=T, name of the parent ms (only needed if the ms has been previously split)

param.name: pdftk
param.description: For buildpdf=T, full path for pdftk command (in case it is not found)

param.name: channeldiff
param.description: Set to a value > 0 (sigma) to plot derivatives of the solutions

param.name: edge
param.description: The number of edge channels to ignore in finding outliers (for channeldiff>0)

param.name: resample
param.description: The channel expansion factor to use when computing MAD of derivative (for channeldiff>0)

param.name: platformingThreshold
param.description: if platformingSigma=0, then declare platforming if the amplitude derivative exceeds this percentage of the median

param.name: platformingSigma
param.description: declare platforming if the amplitude derivative exceeds this many times the MAD

param.name: basebands
param.description: A baseband number or list of baseband numbers for which to display solutions. Default = all.

param.name: showBasebandNumber
param.description: Put the baseband converter number (BBC_NO) in the title of each plot

param.name: scans
param.description: A scan or list of scans for which to display solutions. Default = all. Does not work with overlay="time".

param.name: figfileSequential
param.description: naming scheme for pngs: False: name by spw/antenna (default), True: figfile.000.png, figfile.001.png, etc.

param.name: chanrangeSetXrange
param.description: If True, then chanrange also sets the xrange to display

task.example:
plotbandpass('X3c1.tsys',overlay='antenna',yaxis='amp',field='0~1,4',xaxis='chan',figfile='tsys.png')
plotbandpass('bandpass.bcal',caltable2='bandpass.bcal_smooth',xaxis='freq')
plotbandpass('bandpass.bcal',caltable2='bandpass.bcal_smooth',xaxis='freq',poln='X',showatm=T)
plotbandpass('bandpass.bcal',channeldiff='5')
This task returns void unless the channeldiff option is selected, in which case it returns a dictionary containing the statistics of the solutions, keyed by the antenna name, followed by the spw, timerange, polarization, and finally 'amp' and/or 'phase' depending on the yaxis selection.
Keyword arguments:
antenna: must be either an ID (int or string or list), or a single antenna name or list basebands: show only spws from the specified baseband or list of basebands (default: ''=[]=all) buildpdf: True/False, if True and figfile is set, assemble pngs into a pdf caltable: a bandpass table, of type B or BPOLY caltable2: a second cal table, of type BPOLY or B, to overlay on a B table caltable3: a third cal table, of type BPOLY, to overlay on the first two channeldiff: set to value > 0 to plot derivatives of amplitude, the value is also used as sigma, and any outliers beyond this sigma will be printed to the logger chanrange: set xrange (e.g. "5~100") over which to autoscale y-axis for xaxis='freq' chanrangeSetXrange: if True, then chanrange also sets the xrange to display convert: full path for convert command (in case it's not found) density: dpi to use in creating PNGs and PDFs (default=108) edge: the number of edge channels to ignore in finding outliers (for channeldiff>0) field: must be an ID, source name, or list thereof; can use trailing *: 'J*' figfile: the base_name of the png files to save: base_name.antX.spwY.png figfileSequential: naming scheme, False: name by spw/antenna (default) True: figfile.1.png, figfile.2.png, etc. gs: full path for ghostscript command (in case it's not found) interactive: if False, then figfile will run to completion automatically lo1: specify the LO1 setting (in GHz) for the observation overlay: 'antenna','time','spw', or 'baseband', make 1 plot with different items in colors markersize: size of points (default=3) ms: name of the ms for this table, in case it does not match the string in the caltable parentms: name of the parent ms, in case the ms has been previously split pdftk: full path for pdftk command (in case it's not found) phase: the y-axis limits to use for phase plots when yaxis='both' platformingSigma: declare platforming if the amplitude derivative exceeds this many times the MAD platformingThreshold: if platformingSigma=0, then declare platforming if the amplitude derivative exceeds this percentage of the median plotrange: define axis limits: [x0,x1,y0,y1] where 0,0 means auto poln: polarizations to plot (e.g. 'XX','YY','RR','LL' or '' for both) pwv: define the pwv to use for the showatm option: 'auto' or value in mm resample: channel expansion factor to use when computing MAD of derivative (for channeldiff>0) scans: show only solutions for the specified scans (int, list, or string) showatm: compute and overlay the atmospheric transmission curve (on B or Tsys solutions) showatmfield: use first observation of this fieldID or name showatmPoints: draw atmospheric curve with points instead of a line showBasebandNumber: put the BBC_NO in the title of each plot showfdm: when showing TDM spws with xaxis='freq', draw locations of FDM spws showflagged: show the values of data, even if flagged showimage: also show the atmospheric curve for the image sideband (in black) showtsky: compute and overlay the sky temperature curve instead of transmission showlines: draw lines connecting the data (default=T for amp, F for phase) showpoints: draw points for the data (default=F for amp, T for phase) solutionTimeThresholdSeconds: consider 2 solutions simultaneous if within this interval (default=60) spw: must be single ID or list or range (e.g. 0~4, not the original ID) subplot: 11..81,22,32 or 42 for RowsxColumns (default=22), any 3rd digit is ignored timeranges: show only these timeranges, the first timerange being 0 xaxis: 'chan' or 'freq' yaxis: 'amp', 'tsys', 'phase', or 'both' amp+phase == 'ap'. Append 'db' for dB zoom: 'intersect' will zoom to overlap region of caltable with caltable2
